result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin T Hotchkiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Dwelling, Boat or Motor Home, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(e).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 8/16/16 ADJUDICATION/SENTENCING on ct 1. Counsel will stipulate to credit.

miscConds.notes: $278  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/h adjudication on ct 1. Upon successful completion of Drug Court and probation with no ATR's, revocation & no new crimes rising to the level of probable cause, State will have no objection to termination of probation after 18 mos & agent approves.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.

$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Drug Treatment Court.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.

supervisions.notes: IMPOSED & STAYED. With huber. Consec to ct 2.

miscConds.notes: $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

Preliminary hearing on June 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Angela S. or any of the victims or witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $5,000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jason D. Sanders appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
